how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: For the past 11 years, I could not have performed my daily job at the level I have without the use of TiddlyWiki. It is indispensable. I use it continuously throughout the work day.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox)
outside of plugins, palettes and other i: Yes, I have extensive custom CSS that I wrote, since I am extremely proficient with CSS.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: Backwards compatibility, transparency with future developments.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: Documentation, specific use-case versions, better 'Home' screen experience--think about what HyperCard did.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
